Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[Xamarin.Android.Build.Tests] Add test for ResolveSdks." (#1321) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody: This commit adds a basic unit test for ResolveSdks.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Tapping on the ListView Items take long time to fire." (#1324) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Opening a listView on a button click in Android device. Then tapping on to the ListView item, the ItemTapped event is not get fired.


### Expected Behavior

The Item Tapped event is not get fired easily, after a long time click or continuous click on the list view item makes the item to be tapped

### Actual Behavior

The item has to click normally and the event has to get fired.

### Version Information

Using Mac OS VisualStudio 2017

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[Xamarin.Android.Build.Tasks] Update `CalculateProjectDependencies` to match new spec." (#1323) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
The path separator for the android manifest change from
a `;` to a '/'. This commit updates the `CalculateProjectDependencies`
task to use the new format. It also updates the tests.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[msbuild] Fix <Import>-ed filename, for case sensitivity." (#1322) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
There is a trivial difference between `msbuild` and `xbuild` - `msbuild`
seems to respect (or ignorant of) the fact that filenames that are different
in case are actually different on case-sensitive filesystem.

Thus with `msbuild`, our binding projects don't build due to "missing"
Microsoft.CSharp.Targets (there are only Microsoft.CSharp.targets even in
`xbuild` support files in mono).

This trivial fix should make it work.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[Android] Buttons can be round" (#1935) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###

Adjusting the left padding that was added to make Buttons with a border match the same size as default Buttons in #1570. The padding mismatch made circle Buttons appear to be slightly rectangular.

Also adding a platform specific for Android Buttons that will allow the user to remove this default padding altogether for completely custom buttons.

Before #1570:
![before-1570](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7827070/36458576-5d0c1bbc-1664-11e8-8af0-3b5a96bd01ad.png)


After #1570:
![before](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7827070/36458583-6a95ba54-1664-11e8-9730-3b218fdbcb51.png)


After this change:
![after](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7827070/36458590-70080ac8-1664-11e8-85b5-c801cedb0476.png)



### Bugs Fixed ###

- fixes #1909

### API Changes ###

Added:
- `bool Button.On<Android>().UseNativePadding()`
- `void Button.On<Android>().SetUseNativePadding(true/false)`

### Behavioral Changes ###

None

### PR Checklist ###

- [x] Has tests (if omitted, state reason in description)
- [x] Rebased on top of master at time of PR
- [x] Changes adhere to coding standard
- [x] Consolidate commits as makes sense

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Label is clipped when inside a StackLayout with another Label using TrailTruncation" (#1934) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues

### Description
Migrating this 2+ year old bug here - https://bugzilla.xamarin.com/show_bug.cgi?id=34943

With two labels inside a StackLayout (horizontal), 1 of them will be clipped if the other is too long and gets the ellipses from a TrailTruncation WrapMode setting. 

### Steps to Reproduce

Run sample
Note that the labels are clipped

### Expected Behavior
Labels are not clipped

### Actual Behavior
Labels are clipped

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 2.5.0.280555
- Last known good version: N/A
- IDE: VS2017
- Platform Target Frameworks: <!-- All that apply -->
  - iOS:  yes
  - Android: yes
  - UWP:  not tested
- Android Support Library Version: 25
- Nuget Packages: just forms
- Affected Devices: tested on Nexus 5x running Android 7, and iPhone 5s simulator running iOS 9.3

### Screenshots

https://bugzilla.xamarin.com/attachment.cgi?id=13373

### Reproduction Link

https://www.dropbox.com/s/9m3floclu6v81h7/stacklayouttext.zip?dl=0

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "GTK: App Lifecycle events have not been implemented" (#1933) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms

Events.RelatedBody:
### Description
Following this guide https://blog.xamarin.com/preview-bringing-macos-to-xamarin-forms/ I created a MacOS assembly to run my Xamarin.Forms app in this platform. But trying to run the result gives a NullReferenceException, see below.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Have a Xamarin.Forms app.
2. Add Cocoa(macOS) app, my AppDelegate class is:
```
﻿namespace GWallet.Frontend.XamForms.Mac
open System
open Foundation
open AppKit

open Xamarin.Forms
open Xamarin.Forms.Platform.MacOS

[<Register ("AppDelegate")>]
type AppDelegate () =
    inherit FormsApplicationDelegate ()

    let style = NSWindowStyle.Closable ||| NSWindowStyle.Resizable ||| NSWindowStyle.Titled
    let rect = new CoreGraphics.CGRect(200.0f, 1000.0f, 1024.0f, 768.0f)
    let window = new NSWindow(rect, style, NSBackingStore.Buffered, false)

    do
        window.Title <- "Xamarin.Forms on Mac!"
        window.TitleVisibility <- NSWindowTitleVisibility.Hidden

    override this.MainWindow
        with get() = window

    override this.DidFinishLaunching(notification: NSNotification) =
        Forms.Init()
        this.LoadApplication(new GWallet.Frontend.XF.App())
        // FIXME: the line below reports an NRE which prevents launch
        base.DidFinishLaunching(notification)
```
(My app is opensource, so for reference this is the full commit: https://github.com/knocte/gwallet/commit/448fb0e0135ca50097e8e4a1faacbf46c49d38b7.diff

3. Run the macOS app.

### Expected Behavior
Should run, no exceptions.

### Actual Behavior
Boom:
```
System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object
  at Xamarin.Forms.Platform.MacOS.FormsApplicationDelegate.UpdateMainMenu () [0x00021] in <7e711cd2aa53409881089d77021878ae>:0 
  at Xamarin.Forms.Platform.MacOS.FormsApplicationDelegate.DidFinishLaunching (Foundation.NSNotification notification) [0x00047] in <7e711cd2aa53409881089d77021878ae>:0 
  at GWallet.Frontend.XamForms.Mac.AppDelegate.DidFinishLaunching (Foundation.NSNotification notification) [0x00011] in /Users/andres/Documents/Code/gwalletFRONTEND/src/GWallet.Frontend.XamForms.Mac/AppDelegate.fs:28 
--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
  at (wrapper managed-to-native) AppKit.NSApplication:NSApplicationMain (int,string[])
  at AppKit.NSApplication.Main (System.String[] args) [0x00041] in /Users/builder/data/lanes/5489/1bda16aa/source/xamarin-macios/src/AppKit/NSApplication.cs:100 
  at GWallet.Frontend.XamForms.Mac.main.main (System.String[] args) [0x00015] in /Users/andres/Documents/Code/gwalletFRONTEND/src/GWallet.Frontend.XamForms.Mac/Main.fs:10 
2018-01-25 01:56:43.729 GWallet[96223:55394509] warning: exception inside UnhandledException handler: Object reference not set to an instance of an object
[ERROR] FATAL UNHANDLED EXCEPTION: System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object
  at Xamarin.Forms.Platform.MacOS.FormsApplicationDelegate.UpdateMainMenu () [0x00021] in <7e711cd2aa53409881089d77021878ae>:0 
  at Xamarin.Forms.Platform.MacOS.FormsApplicationDelegate.DidFinishLaunching (Foundation.NSNotification notification) [0x00047] in <7e711cd2aa53409881089d77021878ae>:0 
  at GWallet.Frontend.XamForms.Mac.AppDelegate.DidFinishLaunching (Foundation.NSNotification notification) [0x00011] in /Users/andres/Documents/Code/gwalletFRONTEND/src/GWallet.Frontend.XamForms.Mac/AppDelegate.fs:28 
--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
  at GWallet.Backend.Infrastructure.Report[a] (System.Exception ex) [0x0000c] in /Users/andres/Documents/Code/gwalletFRONTEND/src/GWallet.Backend/Infrastructure.fs:19 
  at GWallet.Backend.Infrastructure.OnUnhandledException[a] (System.Object sender, System.UnhandledExceptionEventArgs args) [0x00000] in /Users/andres/Documents/Code/gwalletFRONTEND/src/GWallet.Backend/Infrastructure.fs:25 
  at GWallet.Backend.Infrastructure+SetupSentryHook@28-4.Invoke (System.Object sender, System.UnhandledExceptionEventArgs e) [0x00000] in /Users/andres/Documents/Code/gwalletFRONTEND/src/GWallet.Backend/Infrastructure.fs:28 
```

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 2.5.0.122203
- IDE: VS for Mac 7.3.3 (build 5)
- Platform Target Frameworks:
  - Mac: High Sierra 10.13.1

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Nuget] Add .Design dll's back" (#1842) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description

Nightly and packages from master are not producing the .Design dll's with metadata info for VisualStudio, we need to add those projects back to the .sln and add the .dlls to the nupkg.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Mac] Help with Runtime.GetNSObject on a dynamically loaded Xamarin.Mac runtime" (#3555) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
I am trying to update Mono's Winforms stack to use Cocoa, and would like to do this without
setting up a bundle.   There are a few blog posts that describe how to achieve this, but before
I can even get there, I ran into a Xamarin.Mac problem that prevents me from getting the basics
in place.

The `NSApplication.SharedApplication` property is supposed to initialize `NSApplication` on 
demand, and this seems to work, but I get a `null` from our own runtime, which seems to fail
to locate the type.

I could use some help figuring out how to make this work.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Download the application attached here (a Xamarin.Mac application), compile.
2. Go into the shell and run this command:

```
$ cd loader/bin/Debug/loader.app/Contents/MonoBundle
$ DYLD_LIBRARY_PATH=/Library/Frameworks/Xamarin.Mac.framework/Versions/Current//lib/ MONO_PATH=. mono loader.exe 
```
Reports that the `NSApplication.SharedApplication` is null, despite the fact, that it is not.   
The code immediately following it shows that calling the low-level code returns a value,
and if you look at the class for the type, it returns an actual NSApplication object, but 
somehow the logic in Runtime.TryGetNSObject<NSApplication> does not return a match.

### Expected Behavior

This should show the first line of the output as:

```
$ DYLD_LIBRARY_PATH=/Library/Frameworks/Xamarin.Mac.framework/Versions/Current//lib/ MONO_PATH=. mono loader.exe 
NSApplication.Shared is: <NSApplication: 0x604000116da0>
...
```

### Actual Behavior

When executed from the command line, the first line of output shows a null result:

```
$ DYLD_LIBRARY_PATH=/Library/Frameworks/Xamarin.Mac.framework/Versions/Current//lib/ MONO_PATH=. mono loader.exe 
NSApplication.Shared is: 
...
```
### Example Project (If Possible)

<!--
1. Place cursor below this comment block.

2. Drag and drop the compressed project or files needed to reproduce.
-->
[loader.tar.gz](https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/files/1742798/loader.tar.gz)

<!--
Switch to the "Preview" tab to ensure your issue renders correctly.
-->

Closed issue "[XI] RuntimeFeatureTest.NoNewFeaturesAdded failure in mscorlib tests" (#3533) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Update System to Xamarin.iOS d15-7 build, mtouch 11.10.0.1 (d15-7: eadb8376)
2. Execute mscorlib tests on iOS and tvOS device

### Expected Behavior
Tests should pass

### Actual Behavior
RuntimeFeatureTest
2018-02-18 21:41:04.320 mscorlibtests[55322:12178179] 	[FAIL] RuntimeFeatureTest.NoNewFeaturesAdded :   Expected is <System.ValueTuple`2[System.String,System.Boolean][1]>, actual is <System.ValueTuple`2[System.String,System.Boolean][0]>
  Values differ at index [0]

### Environment

```
mtouch 11.10.0.1 (d15-7: eadb8376)
```

### Build Logs

XI Test Log: http://xqa.blob.core.windows.net/gist/log-38175501bfc743d9862974451b9997ce.txt

tvOS build log: http://xqa.blob.core.windows.net/gist/report-c3fa275a07304e95bb8f58315d7cbfe9.txt
Test Log:http://xqa.blob.core.windows.net/gist/mscorlib-tvos08-41-5785652fd1ecb4eddd80ebefb1562b316473fa559b08-41-57-8940ddcbc60a417aba807f4d43c6cc8d.zip

###Regression: yes. This failure is not observed in d15-6.
